Class GUITimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUITimer

  • public class GUITimer
extends java.lang.Object
    GUITimer is a wrapper class for Swing Timer; gets started by GibbotGUI3 and is used for animations. GUILayeredPane.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) listens for timer fires and calls GUISerialPort.update() in response, so that individual components don't all have to. Any object in the GUI that adds itself as an ActionListener using addActionListener 'hears' the timer fires, and does with them what it wishes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int millisPerFrame
      Time, in milliseconds, between each timer fire
      private static int serialFactor
      How many timer fires per one serial update (to limit bugs in serial comm without slowing down the whole program)
      private static javax.swing.Timer timer
      Timer object that is wrapped by this class

      static int getSerialFactor()
      Returns serialFactor
      static void removeActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
      Currently unused in code, but can be used if component should not 'hear' timer fires anymore for some reason.
      static void start()
      Starts the timer object with initially no ActionListener objects associated with it
